This is the paradox of Hillary Clinton.  She has achieved something no one else in the history of the American politics has ever come close to doing, yet is widely considered an inept, flawed candidate.  These two things are not unrelated.  Twice now, we have thought it should be easy for Clinton to do what no one has ever done before.  Twice now, we have dismissed her as a weak candidate and a flawed leader for struggling to break a barrier no one else has ever come near to breaking.  America has hosted 56 presidential elections, 33 of them before women received the right of vote.
